Tanzania president wins landslide election victory after days of deadly protests
subhead: Samia Suluhu Hassan won 97.66% of the vote, the electoral commission announced on state television. The main opposition party, Chadema, says hundreds of people have been killed by security forces since protests broke out on election day on Wednesday.

title: Israel says latest remains received from Hamas not hostages
subhead: Israel's military said that a forensic analysis revealed that three bodies it received via the Red Cross on Friday were not those of any of the deceased captives still to be handed over as part of the ceasefire deal.

title: A dizzying dive into Bob Wilson's Long Island theater of objects
subhead: Famous for his groundbreaking shows, the American stage director, who died this summer at the age of 83, was also a great lover of art and design. A compulsive collector of chairs, which he created for his productions, he left behind thousands of works gathered throughout his life, spread between his Manhattan loft-studio, storage warehouses and the Water Mill art center, which he founded on Long Island.

title: The unstoppable rise of Rheinmetall, Germany's tank and munitions giant
subhead: The arms company led by Armin Papperger has seen its share price soar since 2022. Through a flurry of acquisitions and partnerships, he aims to create a 'pan-European defense ecosystem' on land, sea, air and in space.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: 'Airbnb has shaped the idea that everything can be monetized. It's a logic of constant optimization'
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (2/6). In Paris, about one-third of the listings available on Airbnb have been removed from the 'permanent' housing market, which contributes to the housing crisis in the French capital, explains researcher Jeanne Richon in an interview with Le Monde.
